snippet: Tests of more than 1,300 types of rice and rice products found that arsenic levels ranged from 3 to 7 micrograms per serving, amounts that the Food and Drug Administration said did not pose health risks.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration says it has found no evidence that current levels of arsenic in rice pose an immediate health risk.
lead_paragraph: Tests of more than 1,300 types of rice and rice products found that arsenic levels ranged from 3 to 7 micrograms per serving, amounts that the Food and Drug Administration said did not pose health risks.

headline.main: No Immediate Risk Is Found From Arsenic Levels in Rice
headline.print_headline: No Immediate Risk Is Found From Arsenic Levels in Rice
